Data Pipeline API Reference

This section documents all modules in the data_pipeline package.

Parsers

PDFParser using OpenAI GPT-4o vision API for robust PDF extraction.

class api.data_pipeline.parsers.basic_parser.SimpleAzurePDFParser(config: AppConfig)

Bases: object

Parser for PDF documents using Azure Form Recognizer.

This class recursively extracts text content and saves parsed data to .txt files.

parse_and_save(input_path, output_path)

Parse PDF and save extracted text to output_path.

Returns:

This function does not return a value; it saves the parsed content to the specified output path.

Return type:

None

class api.data_pipeline.parsers.enhanced_parser.ComplexAzurePDFParser(config: AppConfig)

Bases: object

Parser for PDF documents using Azure Form Recognizer.

This class recursively loads PDFs from a folder, extracts text, tables, and math equations, and attaches detailed metadata (grade, subject, exam type, etc.) to each chunk.

parse_all_pdfs() → List[Document]

Parse all PDFs in a folder and save results to a JSONL file.

Returns:

Parsed document objects.

Return type:

List[Document]

save_documents_to_jsonl(documents: List[Document])

Save a list of LangChain Document objects to a JSONL file.

Parameters:

documents (List[Document]) – List of parsed documents to save.

Loaders

Module for loading data from various sources (e.g., files, folders).

class api.data_pipeline.loaders.data_loader.DataLoader

Bases: object

load(path)

Load data from a file or all .txt files in a directory. Returns a dict: {filename: content}

load_and_save(input_path, output_path)

Load text from input_path and save to output_path.

Chunkers

Chunker using LangChain’s TextSplitter for advanced chunking.

class api.data_pipeline.chunkers.chunker.Chunker(config: AppConfig)

Bases: object

chunk(text)

Split text into chunks. Returns a list of text chunks.

chunk_file(input_path, output_path)

Read text from input_path, chunk it, and save to output_path.

class api.data_pipeline.chunkers.smart_chunker.SmartChunker(config: AppConfig)

Bases: object

Smart chunker for parsed documents. Applies hybrid chunking strategy: - Tables and math blocks are kept intact. - Text blocks are recursively split for optimal embedding. - Nearby tables/math are merged with text chunks when useful.

process(input_path: Path, output_path: Path) → List[Document]

Full process: load parsed JSONL, chunk documents, and save to output.

Parameters:

  • input_path (Path) – Path to parsed JSONL input.

  • output_path (Path) – Path to write chunked JSONL output.

Returns:

Chunked documents.

Return type:

List[Document]

Vector Stores

class api.data_pipeline.vectorstores.vector_store.ExamMeta(*, branch: List[str], subject: str, title: str)

Bases: BaseModel

branch: List[str]
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

subject: str
title: str
to_embedding_text() → str

Text that will be embedded.

class api.data_pipeline.vectorstores.vector_store.MetaDict

Bases: TypedDict

branch: List[str]
full_chunk: str
subject: str
class api.data_pipeline.vectorstores.vector_store.VectorStore(config: AppConfig)

Bases: object

ALLOWED_BRANCHES = ['general science', 'life science', 'arts and humanities', 'social and economic sciences', 'middle school certificate']
JSON_PROMPT = 'You are given a chunk of text that belongs to an exam document.\nExtract the following JSON ONLY (no extra keys, no markdown). ⚠️  The `branch` field MUST be a list whose elements are chosen ONLY from the following English terms exactly as written (case‑insensitive): ["general science", "life science", "arts and humanities", "social and economic sciences" ""middle school certificate"]. If more than one branch applies include all relevant entries; otherwise use an empty list [].\n{{\n  "branch": ["<one or more from the allowed list>"],\n  "subject": "<course name>",\n  "title":   "<a 1‑sentence descriptive title in English>"\n}}\nChunk:\n{chunk}\nJSON:'
async add_documents(chunks: List[str]) → None
async search(query: str, k: int = 5)
class api.data_pipeline.vectorstores.vector_store_standard.StandardVectorStore(config: AppConfig, embedding_model: OpenAIEmbeddings | None = None)

Bases: object

Standard version: Stores all documents in a single Chroma vector DB.

build_vectorstore(docs: List[Document]) → Chroma
load_documents_from_jsonl(jsonl_path: Path) → List[Document]
load_vectorstore() → Chroma
save_metadata(docs: List[Document])
class api.data_pipeline.vectorstores.vector_store_versioned.VersionedVectorStore(config: AppConfig, embedding_model: OpenAIEmbeddings | None = None)

Bases: object

Versioned vector store: builds one Chroma DB per (subject, grade) group.

build_all(input_jsonl: Path, base_dir: Path = PosixPath('chroma_store'))
build_vectorstore(docs: List[Document], persist_dir: Path, collection_name: str) → Chroma
group_documents_by_subject_grade(docs: List[Document]) → Dict[str, List[Document]]
load_documents_from_jsonl(jsonl_path: Path) → List[Document]
load_vectorstore(persist_dir: Path, collection_name: str) → Chroma
save_metadata(persist_dir: Path, docs: List[Document], collection_name: str)

Main Pipeline Script

api.data_pipeline.pipeline.run_pipeline(input_folder: Path, output_dir: Path = PosixPath('outputs'), embedding_mode: str = 'standard')

Runs the full pipeline: parsing → chunking → vectorstore.

Parameters:

  • input_folder (Path) – Folder containing PDF documents.

  • output_dir (Path) – Output folder for JSONL files and Chroma DB.

  • embedding_mode (str) – “standard” or “versioned”
